Articles.Content:
Hello everybody! After accustoming to new aerodynamics I want to show you one of my newest planes in 1.0.

***Mikoyan-Gurevich MiG-21***

![tOwgrN3.png](http://i.imgur.com/tOwgrN3.png)

The Mikoyan-Gurevich MiG-21 is a supersonic jet fighter aircraft, designed by the Mikoyan-Gurevich Design Bureau in the Soviet Union. Approximately 60 countries over four continents have flown the MiG-21, and it still serves many nations a half-century after its maiden flight. The fighter made aviation records. At least by name, it is the most-produced supersonic jet aircraft in aviation history and the most-produced combat aircraft since the Korean War, and it had the longest production run of a combat aircraft (1959 to 1985 over all variants).

Some pics:

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/lipHO)

Partcount - 352 (with armament)

Hotkeys:

1 - toggle engine

2 - deploy chutes

3 - activate ejectable seat

4 - deploy seat's chutes

Download - [click](http://www./download/rt67ufem2cz4eys/MiG-21+with+cockpit.craft)!

Thank you for your attention!

Fly safe!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-23T12:44:29Z" title="05/23/2015 12:44  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 23, 2015</time> by Nik\_601**

Good job .

I must try a cockpit like that , good looking effect ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

I've improved MiG-21 a little, so now it has two solid-fuel boosters and some armament:

![wQMBsm9.png](http://i.imgur.com/wQMBsm9.png)

![0jviSFQ.png](http://i.imgur.com/0jviSFQ.png)
Nice, dude! Loving the seat! the replica is awesome, don't get me wrong, but I'm more interested in the seat, mind if I make this a subassembly that I can use in my builds?

> 
> Nice, dude! Loving the seat! the replica is awesome, don't get me wrong, but I'm more interested in the seat, mind if I make this a subassembly that I can use in my builds?

Thanks! And yes, you can use it freely, of course ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

As far as I know the basic jet engine doesn't look like that.

Did you change the model and/or texture of the jet engine?

> 
> As far as I know the basic jet engine doesn't look like that.
> Did you change the model and/or texture of the jet engine?

Oh! That's really great design! I don't think he did, I think it's just two jet engines clipped inside each other, with one being rotated slightly. I might be wrong but that's my only theory to why it would look different.

> 
> As far as I know the basic jet engine doesn't look like that.
> Did you change the model and/or texture of the jet engine?

BriXman is right - I clipped two engines for close to IRL performance and one engine was rotated a little, so that doubled engine looks more smooth
